title: Janusz Kaminski
review: The cinematography was so well done by Janusz Kaminski.  In almost every scene, the light streaming in through the windows or the flare around lights gave the movie a dreamy, fairy-tale-like quality.  Along with the campy music and the bright and colorful costumes and scenery, it rounded out the film's light-hearted view of this story.  Kaminski did this in A.I. as well, though the effect was much less light-hearted, but still wistful and poetic. Although I like this effect, I hope it doesn't become a Janusz Kaminski trademark, like John Woo and his doves.
